Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Type A (or related) cup; interior: in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of naked youth to right (part of torso, right arm, buttock and thighs remaining; chlamys wrapped over the lost left arm); exterior: glazed save for edge of foot; inderside and inside of foot reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Beazley identifies the sherd as belonging to the Leafless Group.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 432, no. B694, pl. CCXI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1429) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
